intro: Lithocarpus tapintzensis, commonly known as the Tapintzén lithocarpus, is a species of evergreen tree native to the cloud forests of western Ecuador. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, woody fruit known as a cupule. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at mid to high elevations. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and dark green, with a prominent midrib. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
